{{Infobox Political post |post = Prime Minister |body = Malaysia |insignia = |insigniacaption = [[Emblem of Malaysia|Coat of Arms of Malaysia]] |image = Dato Sri Mohd Najib Tun Razak.JPG|150px |incumbent = [[Najib Razak]] |incumbentsince = 3 April 2009 |deputy = [[Deputy Prime Minister of Malaysia]] |style = [[Malay titles|Yang Amat Berhormat]] (The Most Honourable) |residence = [[Seri Perdana]] |appointer = [[Yang di-Pertuan Agong]] |termlength = While commanding the [[confidence and supply|confidence]] of the [[Dewan Rakyat|House of Representatives]] |inaugural = [[Tunku Abdul Rahman|Abdul Rahman]] |formation = 31 August 1957 |salary = |website = [http://www.pmo.gov.my/ PM's official website] }} {{Politics of Malaysia}} The '''Prime Minister of Malaysia''' is the indirectly elected [[head of government|head of government (executive)]] of [[Malaysia]]. He is officially appointed by the [[Yang di-Pertuan Agong]], the [[head of state]], who in [[Majesty|HM's]] judgment is likely to command the confidence of the majority of the members of that [[Dewan Rakyat|House of Representatives (Dewan Rakyat)]], the elected lower house of [[Parliament of Malaysia|Parliament]]. He heads the [[Cabinet of Malaysia|Cabinet]], whose members are appointed by the Yang di-Pertuan Agong on the prime minister's advice. The Prime Minister and his [[Cabinet of Malaysia|Cabinet]] shall be collectively responsible to Parliament. The [[Prime Minister's Department]] (sometimes referred to as the Prime Minister's Office) is the body and ministry in which the Prime Minister exercises its functions and powers. The current prime minister is [[Najib Razak]]. == Requirements for taking office == According to the [[Constitution of Malaysia|constitution]], the Prime Minister must be a member of the House of Representatives and command the confidence of the majority members of [[Dewan Rakyat]]; citizen of [[Malaysia]] but not by [[naturalization]]. The Prime Minister and his cabinet ministers shall take and subscribe in the presence of Yang di-Pertuan Agong the oath of office and allegiance and the oath of secrecy before exercise the functions of the office. The Prime Minister and his cabinet ministers shall not be a member of legislative assembly of any state. The Cabinet shall be collectively responsible to Parliament. Although statutory states that the Yang di-Pertuan Agong has his discretion in the appointment of the prime minister, the appointment is invariably given to the chief of the dominant party which commanding the most seats in lower house of parliament. If the Prime Minister ceases to command the confidence of the majority of the members of the House of Representatives, then, unless at his request the Yang di-Pertuan Agong dissolves Parliament, the Prime Minister shall tender the resignation of the Cabinet. == List of Prime Ministers of Malaysia == {{legend2|#FFE8E8|[[United Malays National Organisation]] (UMNO)|border=1px solid #AAAAAA}} {{legend2|#99BADD|[[Alliance Party (Malaya)|Alliance Party]] (AP)|border=1px solid #AAAAAA}} {{legend2|#ADD8E6|[[Barisan Nasional|National Front]] (BN)|border=1px solid #AAAAAA}} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- bgcolor=#cccccc ! width=30| Term ! width=30| No. ! width=150|Name

MP for Pekan |align="center"| [[File:Dato Sri Mohd Najib Tun Razak.JPG|110px]] |align="center"| 3 April 2009 |align="center"| Incumbent |align="center"| [[United Malays National Organisation|UMNO]] |align="center" bgcolor=#ADD8E6| [[Barisan Nasional|BN]] |} ==Trivia== The prime minister has been from the [[UMNO|United Malays National Organisation (UMNO)]] since independence. It is the largest component party of the [[Barisan Nasional|Barisan Nasional (National Front)]], which formerly known as the [[Alliance Party (Malaya)|Perikatan (Alliance Party)]] until the 1969 general election, which forms the government (executive) since independence. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Prime Ministers and First Ladies of Malaysia}} {{Southeast Asian leaders}} {{Federal Government of Malaysia}} [[Category:Lists of prime ministers|Malaysia]] [[Category:Prime Ministers of Malaysia| ]] [[Category:Malaysia-related lists]] [[bn:à¦®à¦¾à¦²à¦¯à¦¼à§à¦¶à¦¿à¦¯à¦¼à¦¾à¦° à¦ªà§à¦°à¦§à¦¾à¦¨à¦®à¦¨à§à¦¤à§à¦°à§]] [[da:Malaysias premierministre]] [[de:Liste der Premierminister Malaysias]] [[es:Anexo:Primeros ministros de Malasia]] [[fr:Liste des Premiers ministres malaisiens]] [[hi:à¤®à¤²à¥à¤¶à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨ à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥]] [[id:Daftar Perdana Menteri Malaysia]] [[jv:Perdhana Mentri Malaysia]] [[ms:Perdana Menteri Malaysia]] [[nl:Lijst van premiers van MaleisiÃ«]] [[ja:ãã¬ã¼ã·ã¢ã®é¦ç¸]] [[no:Liste over Malaysias statsministre]] [[pl:Premierzy Malezji]] [[ru:Ð¡Ð¿Ð¸ÑÐ¾Ðº Ð¿ÑÐµÐ¼ÑÐµÑ-Ð¼Ð¸Ð½Ð¸ÑÑÑÐ¾Ð² ÐÐ°Ð»Ð°Ð¹Ð·Ð¸Ð¸]] [[su:Perdana Mentri Malaysia]] [[th:à¸£à¸²à¸¢à¸à¸²à¸¡à¸à¸²à¸¢à¸à¸£à¸±à¸à¸¡à¸à¸à¸£à¸µà¸¡à¸²à¹à¸¥à¹à¸à¸µà¸¢]] [[zh:é©¬æ¥è¥¿äºé¦ç¸]]
